definitions.definition: a narrow tube with a bowl at one end, used for smoking tobacco

examples.text: He knocked out his pipe in the big glass ashtray.

definitions.definition: a musical instrument in the shape of a tube, played by blowing
any of the tubes from which sound is produced in an organ
a musical instrument played especially in Scotland. The player blows air into a bag held under the arm and then slowly forces the air out through pipes to produce a noise.

wordOrigin: Old English pīpe ‘musical tube’, pīpian ‘play a pipe’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch pijp and German Pfeife, based on Latin pipare ‘to peep, chirp’, reinforced in Middle English by Old French piper ‘to chirp, squeak’.
